column4: hi i'm having a problem with firefox in 8.04. it won't play video. I've tried to install plugins but none of them work. most websites video doesnt work. any suggestions?
i'm not sure if its flash or not
yes
I get an error that my hardware isnt supported or some such thing
no i havent tried that. how do i do that?
you might want to go into syaptec and check that only one flash player is enabled
open synaptic
are you downloading from the adobe website?
i couldnt get any video until i disabled that
is flashplugin-nonfree on the list
it is not in the list
is swfdec on the list
yes it is
are any of them checked off?
some of them are yes
u could try: sudo apt-get remove flashplugin-nonfree amd then install swfdec in synaptic
done
i have swfdec installed but when i go to a website with flash it tells me i need flash installed to see the video?
so try again with sudo apt-get install flashplugin-nonfree
u have no luck after removing swdefc and reinstalling adobe?
correct. i get an error: wrong architecture 'i386'
im sorr i cant be of any more use
thanks anyway. can anyone else help here?
congrats
